pageTitle: CA IMMOBILIEN ANLAGEN AG (CAI:Wiener Borse): Stock Quote & Company Profile - Businessweek
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {4840=CA Immobilien Anlagen Aktiengesellschaft, together with its subsidiaries, operates as a property investment and management company in Europe. Its commercial real estate properties include offices, shopping centres, logistics parks, storage facilities, and business hotels; and residential properties comprise apartment houses and condominium flats. As of December 31, 2007, the company’s property portfolio comprised 212 properties in Poland, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, Slovenia, Serbia, Russia, Austria, and Germany. CA Immobilien Anlagen was founded in 1987 and is headquartered in Vienna, Austria with additional offices in Berlin, Germany and Bavaria, Germany., 8983=CA Immo raised the first quarter of 2015 net profit by 39.2% year on year to EUR 19.3 million. Net income from rent fell by 6% year on year to EUR 31.2 million. EBITDA shrank by 18.2% to EUR 27.8 million, worse than the 14% drop expected by the market., 9588=CA Immobilien Anlagen AG announced that the medium term dividend payment objective will be raised from 2.0% to 2.5% of net asset value (NAV). On the basis of enhanced FFO I expectations, the company will aim to pay a dividend of EUR 0.50 per share in business year 2015 compared to EUR 0.45 per share in business year 2014., 10347=CA Immobilien Anlagen AG announced consolidated earnings results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2015. For the quarter, net rental income (NRI) was EUR 31.2 million compared to EUR 33.2 million a year ago. The main reason for the reduction in net rental income was the absence of a contribution from the Lipowy office building in Warsaw, which was sold at the end of the first quarter in 2014. EBITDA was EUR 27.8 million compared to EUR 34.0 million a year ago. EBIT was EUR 25.2 million compared to EUR 38.3 million a year ago. Earnings before tax was EUR 18.3 million compared to EUR 17.9 million a year ago. Net profit was EUR 19.3 million or EUR 0.20 per diluted share against EUR 13.9 million or EUR 0.15 per diluted share a year ago. EPRA NAV per diluted share was EUR 22.06 against EUR 21.90 a year ago. EPRA NNNAV per diluted share was EUR 20.56 against EUR 20.36 a year ago. Net operating income up 39.2% at EUR 19.3 million, equivalent to EUR 0.20 per share. The company’s the FFO I objective of EUR 80 million for business year 2015 reflects continually rising recurring profitability. Where planned sales revenue is taken into consideration, an FFO II in excess of EUR 100 million is anticipated for business year 2015.}
